hypothesis_content.title: Failed Breakdown Reversal Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When price breaks below a key support level (≥2 prior touches) on increasing volume but reclaims the level within 3 candles AND forms a bullish engulfing pattern at the reclaimed level, a sharp reversal breakout upward will occur with minimum 6% move within 36 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Failed breakdowns trap bears and liquidate short positions. Quick reclaim with bullish pattern indicates strong rejection of lower prices. Bullish RSI divergence confirms weakening selling momentum during false breakdown.
entry_conditions: Price breaks below established support (≥2 prior touches) on >120% volume
Price reclaims support level within 3 candles of breakdown
Bullish engulfing pattern forms at reclaimed support level
RSI(14) on 4H shows bullish divergence (higher low) during breakdown

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks below recent breakdown low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price fails to achieve >3% upward move within 12 hours of entry OR volume on upward move is <80% of breakdown volume.
